body.p:
Court House Springfield Ky
Nov 14th 1860
Dear Gov

Young Mr Chessar whose father will hand this to You with a petition praying a remission of a fine and imprisonment is a very poor, hard working young man with a good character and his habits have heretofore been good.

The facts of his case are set out in the petition which was drawn by my colleagues and which I signed. but the old gentleman is so anxious to have a seperate note from me -- That I pause in the middle of a trial to write the above facts -- Such favor as the facts may authorize You to give him would not be improperly bestowed
Our circuit court is in session and will last some ten days yet -- Could you not dropcome down and see us. Your old friends would all be glad to meet and welcome You

In great haste I am
Very truly
Your friend
T B Hardin
